history.content: <md>AC courses generally have a lot of readings and writings but I've heard that music26ac is on the lighter side of courses. It wouldn't hurt to replace with a DeCal ***if*** you find a decal that interests you. If you cannot find one, well, either way, you apply to DeCals in the fall so I would signup for music26ac and if its too much work, well the late drop deadline exists :)</md>

children.subject: This would be a pretty standard L&S CS workload. I think advisors tend to recommend reduced workloads for prefrosh so you can adjust better to college life and stuff, which is something you should consider. That said, this is totally manageable if you work hard. Just be aware that a schedule like this will probably be pretty demanding academically compared to high school.

history.content:
Hi!

I'm an incoming L&S CS freshman. I would like some input on my intended schedule for my first semester.

This is what I have:

  • CS 61A, 4 units
  • MATH 1A, 4 units
  • CHICANO R1A, 4 units
  • MUSIC 26AC, 4 units

People keep telling it's a lot for first semester, but I figure I would get my American Cultures requirement and one of my breadths done with 26AC. 

And 1A would be review since I just did AP Calc AB during my senior year. But I am thinking of doing 1B instead since I did well both semesters but I'm also waiting on my AP score that I'll get in mid-July.

I'm also waiting on my AP score for English Lit, but I doubt I'll get a 5 to skip my Reading & Composition requirement altogether. I am hoping I somehow get a 4 though!

Should I replace MUSIC 26AC with a DeCal? Any help would be appreciated. Thank you!
history.subject: Is this schedule too much?
